meanings.definition: Having a sickly or nauseated feeling, especially due to overindulgence in food or drink.
meanings.sent1: After eating too much cake, she felt liverish and had to lie down.
meanings.sent2: He always feels liverish after eating spicy food.
meanings.sent3: Despite feeling liverish, she couldn't resist the temptation of the buffet.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the garbage made him feel liverish, like he had eaten something rotten.
meanings.sent5: The medicine helped relieve her liverish stomach ache.

meanings.sent1: She becomes liverish when she doesn't get enough sleep.
meanings.sent2: His liverish mood improved after he took a short nap.
meanings.sent3: Even the calmest person can become liverish when stuck in traffic.
meanings.sent4: The dog seemed liverish, growling at everyone who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's liverish tone scared the students into silence.
